p: The potential threats posed by climate change in the coming decades are eliciting growing global awareness and concern. Rising sea levels and changes in precipitation and temperature patterns are creating more favorable conditions for diseases and threatening food security [ 1– 4]. If the frequency of conflicts increases with the warming of the planet, these risks may be amplified by weakened governance capacity and economic disruptions [ 5– 6]. For the 21 st century, climate change appears set to be a defining international public crisis.
